SEARCH
Package gw.pl.system.util

Class DateRange

java.lang.Object
gw.pl.system.util.DateRange
public class DateRange extends Object
Represents a continuous range of dates. The range is defined by a start and end date. All dates on or after the start date and before the end date are included in the range. Ranges can be unbounded on either side. For example, one could define a range representing all dates before 22-Mar-2006.
Author:
pdalbora

  • Field Details

    • ALL_DATES

      public static final DateRange ALL_DATES
      A range representing all dates.

  • Method Details

    • allDatesBefore

      public static DateRange allDatesBefore(Date d)
      Returns a range representing all dates before the given date. If the given date is null, this range is equivalent to ALL_DATES.

    • allDatesAfter

      public static DateRange allDatesAfter(Date d)
      Returns a range representing all dates after the given date. If the given date is null, this range is equivalent to ALL_DATES.

    • allDatesOnOrAfter

      public static DateRange allDatesOnOrAfter(Date d)
      Returns a range representing all dates on or after the given date. If the given date is null, this range is equivalent to ALL_DATES.

    • allDatesBetween

      public static DateRange allDatesBetween(Date start, Date end)
      Returns a range representing all dates on or after the given start date and before the given end date. If an argument is null, then its side of the range is unbounded. If start is on or after end, then then range is equivalent to the empty range.

    • allDatesIncluding

      public static DateRange allDatesIncluding(Date start, Date end)
      Returns a range representing all dates on or after the given start date and including the given end date. If an argument is null, then its side of the range is unbounded. If start is after end, then then range is equivalent to the empty range.

    • includes

      public boolean includes(Date d)
      Determines whether or not the given date lies within the range.

    • intersect

      public DateRange intersect(DateRange value)
      Return the intersection between this date range and value, else return null.

    • overlaps

      public boolean overlaps(DateRange value)
      Return true if this date range overlaps the value.

    • getNumOfLeapYearDays

      public int getNumOfLeapYearDays()
      Calculates the number of leap days (Feb. 29) in this range, shifted by one day. Returns 0 if the range is unbounded.
      See Also:
      • getLeapDays()

    • getLeapDays

      public List<Date> getLeapDays()
      Calculates the list of leap days (Feb. 29) in this range, shifted by one day. The range is shifted by one day, because we don't want to consider leap days at the start of a range, and instead consider those at the end of the range. Therefore, the range [2/29, 3/1) is considered to have 0 leap days, while the range [2/28, 2/29) is considered to have 1. Returns an empty list if the range is unbounded.

    • abuts

      public boolean abuts(DateRange value)
      Return true if this date range abuts the value. This can only happen on a bounded end.

    • numDays

      public int numDays()
      Returns:
      Integer.MAX_VALUE if the DateRange is unbounded, 0 days if the end date is before the start date and otherwise the number of days in the date range
